intro: Henriettella hispidula, commonly known as the hairy henriettella, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, which are covered in fine, short hairs. Its small, pinkish-white flowers bloom in late summer, adding ornamental value to its habitat. Henriettella hispidula is often found in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions.
